# groupsByEvent

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the manager automatically creates undo groups around each pass of the run loop.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var groupsByEvent: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the manager automatically creates undo groups around each pass of the run loop, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

The default is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. If you turn automatic grouping off, you must close groups explicitly before invoking either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undo()] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()].

## Creating undo groups

- **beginUndoGrouping()**: Marks the beginning of an undo group.
- **endUndoGrouping()**: Marks the end of an undo group.
- **groupingLevel**: The number of nested undo groups (or redo groups, if redo is the most recent operation) in the current event loop.
